      • separateEntry

        public int separateEntry(java.lang.String entry)
        This method separates the entry given by the user and calls the required methods to start the game
        pre: the entry follows the format rows columns snakes ladders players(number or symbols)
        pos: gameboard is assigned, linked list started by firstPlayer isn't empty
        Parameters:
        entry, - given by the user. entry != null, entry != ""
        Returns:
        0 when the entry is correct, 1 when the snakes and ladders don't fit the grid, 2 when there's more than 9 players

      • generateSymbols

        public java.lang.String generateSymbols()
        This method generates a random symbol of the following: * ! O X % $ # + &
        pre:
        pos:
        Returns:
        symbol, which is a String with the symbol generated

      • symbolExist

        public boolean symbolExist(Player first,
                           java.lang.String symbol)
        This metho verifies if some player in the game has the specified symbol in the parameter
        pre:
        pos:
        Parameters:
        first, - it's the first player added to the game, in order to start recursion
        symbol, - it's the symbol that it's been searched for
        Returns:
        a boolean, true if it was found, false otherwise

      • createPlayers

        public void createPlayers(java.lang.String symbol,
                          int num)
        This method creates the number of players contained in a String, without spaces in between and identified by their symbol
        pre: symbol must be an String that contains the symbols enable in the game
        pos: the linked list initiated by firstPlayer now contains symbol.length players
        Parameters:
        symbol - is the string that contains the symbols for the players
        num - it's an auxiliary parameter to iterate through the String

      • createPlayersRandom

        public void createPlayersRandom(int num)
        This method creates a given number of players, each one identified by a different symbol
        pre:
        pos: the linked list initiated by firstPlayer now contains num players
        Parameters:
        num - it's the number of players that will be created

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(Player newPlayer)
        addPlayer adds a specified player to the circular linked list started and contained in firstPlayer
        pre:
        pos: firstPlayer!= null and the circular linked list has a new element
        Parameters:
        newPlayer - the player that is going to be added

      • createSnakes

        public void createSnakes(int code,
                         int max)
        This method creates a defined number of snakes in random cells
        pre: gameboard is initialized and contains a GameGrid
        pos: random cells of gambeboard have the attribute snake set and different than ''
        Parameters:
        code - it's the ASCII code for the letter A
        max - it's the ASCII code of the last snake to create, calculated as: letter A's ASCII code + number of snakes -1

      • createLadders

        public void createLadders(int ladder,
                          int max)
        This method creates a defined number of ladders in random cells
        pre: gameboard is initialized and contains a GameGrid
        pos: random cells of gambeboard have the attribute ladder set and different than 0
        Parameters:
        code - it's number 1, in order to start recursion
        max - it's maximum number of ladders that the game will contain

      • createSingleLadder

        public void createSingleLadder(int start,
                               int end,
                               int ladder)
        This method creates one ladder with the cells given (identified by number in the GameGrid) and the number of ladder
        pre: gameboard is initialized and contains a GameGrid
        pos: the specified cells have the attribute ladder set and different from 0
        Parameters:
        start - the number of the cell where the ladder starts.
        end - the number of the cell where the ladder ends.
        ladder - ladder identifier.

      • createSingleSnake

        public void createSingleSnake(int start,
                              int end,
                              int code)
        This method creates one snake with the cells given (identified by number in the GameGrid) and the letter for the snake
        pre: gameboard is initialized and contains a GameGrid
        pos: the specified cells have the attribute snake set and different than ''
        Parameters:
        start - the number of the cell where the snake starts.
        end, - the number of the cell where the snake ends.
        code, - the ASCII code which corresponds to the letter that identifies the snake

      • getRandomCell

        public int getRandomCell(int row)
        It returns a random cell from the gameboard that is located in a different row from the parameter given
        pre: gameboard is initialized
        pos: a random cell number is returned between rows * columns
        Parameters:
        row, - it's the row where the random cell won't be gotten from
        Returns:
        a Cell from gameboard
